1159cc4a-d0b9-4f59-8657-3aec0d75c6af.name: heritage-lottery-fund
1159cc4a-d0b9-4f59-8657-3aec0d75c6af.title: Heritage Lottery Fund
1159cc4a-d0b9-4f59-8657-3aec0d75c6af.description: From the archaeology under our feet to the historic parks we love, from precious memories to rare wildlife… we use money raised by National Lottery players to help people across the UK explore, enjoy and protect the heritage they care about.

76b0d7a2-ad7e-49b0-bbf0-ff6e6f82810b.name: leeds-data-mill
76b0d7a2-ad7e-49b0-bbf0-ff6e6f82810b.title: Data Mill North
76b0d7a2-ad7e-49b0-bbf0-ff6e6f82810b.description: Dat Mill North is the Open Data Platform for the city -  a place for organisations to share their Open Data.

c8e9334a-8b3d-45f2-9870-dfb7883edcf4.name: student-data-labs
c8e9334a-8b3d-45f2-9870-dfb7883edcf4.title: Student Data Labs
c8e9334a-8b3d-45f2-9870-dfb7883edcf4.description: Based in Leeds and established in 2015, Student Data Labs envisions a future where more students can gain highly sought-after data skills that prepare them for entering the labour market upon graduation. The Labs offer a collaborative space for students from a variety of academic backgrounds to undertake real-world data projects, learning practical skills whilst working on projects that have a social purpose.

87b77c2c-de8a-436e-97e0-bf716d748f7b.name: environment-agency
87b77c2c-de8a-436e-97e0-bf716d748f7b.title: Environment Agency
87b77c2c-de8a-436e-97e0-bf716d748f7b.description:
The Environment Agency (EA) work to create better places for people and wildlife, and support sustainable development.
EA is an executive non-departmental public body, sponsored by the Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs.

9934d86f-cc7f-453a-b9d9-859ba50275ec.name: yorkshire-water
9934d86f-cc7f-453a-b9d9-859ba50275ec.title: Yorkshire Water
9934d86f-cc7f-453a-b9d9-859ba50275ec.description:
We manage the collection, treatment and distribution of water in Yorkshire, supplying around 1.24 billion litres of drinking water each day - that's a lot of water.

At the same time we also collect, treat and dispose of about one billion litres of waste water safely back into the environment.

6b3b572f-7ebb-4cc2-9566-de69997443fa.name: hebe-works
6b3b572f-7ebb-4cc2-9566-de69997443fa.title: Hebe Works
6b3b572f-7ebb-4cc2-9566-de69997443fa.description: Transforming the ways that cities are understood - www.hebeworks.com

d920bab7-629d-4637-8ac6-0b2104605f55.name: ordnance-survey
d920bab7-629d-4637-8ac6-0b2104605f55.title: Ordnance Survey
d920bab7-629d-4637-8ac6-0b2104605f55.description: Ordnance Survey is the national mapping agency for Great Britain and is one of the world's largest producers of maps.

1cd0a4db-537d-48de-ac0c-5b1aafcde36a.name: lcc-innovation-labs
1cd0a4db-537d-48de-ac0c-5b1aafcde36a.title: LCC INNOVATION LABS
1cd0a4db-537d-48de-ac0c-5b1aafcde36a.description: Leeds City Council hosts occasional hack events, or Innovation Labs.  Here, we team up analysts, developers, service staff, and users to come up with innovative solutions to everyday issues.

248fba03-2d5c-4d6b-88f9-b8e25300af6b.name: national-rail
248fba03-2d5c-4d6b-88f9-b8e25300af6b.title: National Rail
248fba03-2d5c-4d6b-88f9-b8e25300af6b.description: Providing information from Network Rail and National Rail Enquiries.

cf9a5f4e-a64a-4aa3-bd5e-0b888d937050.name: hscic
cf9a5f4e-a64a-4aa3-bd5e-0b888d937050.title: HSCIC
cf9a5f4e-a64a-4aa3-bd5e-0b888d937050.description: We are the national provider of information, data and IT systems for commissioners, analysts and clinicians in health and social care.  Based in Leeds, HSCIC is an executive non-departmental public body, sponsored by the Department of Health.

3eb947c3-199f-45d6-a064-1c24817ba0a6.name: aspire
3eb947c3-199f-45d6-a064-1c24817ba0a6.title: Aspire
3eb947c3-199f-45d6-a064-1c24817ba0a6.description:
Aspire Community Benefit Society supports people with learning disabilities to have better lives through the provision of high-quality, person-centred, care and support services.  

Aspires purpose is to enhance the quality of the lives of their customers by supporting them to be as independent as possible and reducing the need for residential care.  They want the people they support to have a positive experience of care and support and to ensure they are safeguarded from harm.

def783ba-7a5e-43d3-8754-5dbe5b95430e.name: west-yorkshire-combined-authority
def783ba-7a5e-43d3-8754-5dbe5b95430e.title: West Yorkshire Combined Authority
def783ba-7a5e-43d3-8754-5dbe5b95430e.description: Aiding the development and delivery of individual member councils’ key growth projects and future local plans. Improving local and regional transport links to underpin the development of business and the creation of new jobs.

fcc3d762-3346-4193-bcb8-fc63ff3a5af4.name: west-yorkshire-joint-services
fcc3d762-3346-4193-bcb8-fc63ff3a5af4.title: West Yorkshire Joint Services
fcc3d762-3346-4193-bcb8-fc63ff3a5af4.description: West Yorkshire Joint Services are provided by a Joint Committee of Councillors from the five District Councils within West Yorkshire (Bradford, Calderdale, Kirklees, Leeds, Wakefield). Services include archaeology, archive, ecology, materials testing, analytical services and training standards services.

be1989f4-7067-4600-a560-b52ef79240c8.name: patient-opinion
be1989f4-7067-4600-a560-b52ef79240c8.title: Patient Opinion
be1989f4-7067-4600-a560-b52ef79240c8.description:
An independent site about your experiences of UK health services, good or bad. Patient Opinion pass your stories to the right people to make a difference. 
Patient Opinion was founded in 2005 and is now the UK's leading independent non-profit feedback platform for health services.
Patient Opinion is about honest and meaningful conversations between patients and health services. We believe that your story can help make health services better.

1c58ec82-1ac9-4e53-bc9b-57d33febed93.name: leedscitycouncil
1c58ec82-1ac9-4e53-bc9b-57d33febed93.title: Leeds City Council
1c58ec82-1ac9-4e53-bc9b-57d33febed93.description: Leeds City Council is committed to being open and transparent.  Our pages on Leeds Data Mill will provide details and easy access to the data and information we publish.  Where possible we are making our data available (subject to licence) in a format that allows you to re-use it.

dde5c04f-bba4-43fc-a1b6-4884bee36949.name: companies-house
dde5c04f-bba4-43fc-a1b6-4884bee36949.title: Companies House
dde5c04f-bba4-43fc-a1b6-4884bee36949.description:
Companies House incorporates and dissolves limited companies, registers the information companies are legally required to supply, and makes that information available to the public.
Companies House is an executive agency, sponsored by the Department for Business, Innovation & Skills.

ff8f22de-6bdd-4bc0-bb9d-38c589f2f147.name: leeds-housing-concern
ff8f22de-6bdd-4bc0-bb9d-38c589f2f147.title: Leeds Housing Concern
ff8f22de-6bdd-4bc0-bb9d-38c589f2f147.description: Leeds Housing Concern began as a charity in the 1970's providing housing and support for single homeless people. Now a highly successful organisation, LHC continue to develop new, often pioneering services for people struggling to cope with a broad range of issues including learning difficulties, drug abuse and domestic violence.

3b389bb7-7b1b-48d6-aab8-2a36e4615416.name: met-office
3b389bb7-7b1b-48d6-aab8-2a36e4615416.title: Met Office
3b389bb7-7b1b-48d6-aab8-2a36e4615416.description:
How does the weather affect your life? Is it just about getting out and about at weekends? Or does it impact your work, your livelihood or even your health?

Right across the world, every single day, people make decisions based on the weather. The Met Office provide weather and climate forecasts to help with those decisions so people can be safe, well and prosperous.

16eb9fe0-4cb9-464c-befc-9b2262afa5a6.name: department-of-transport
16eb9fe0-4cb9-464c-befc-9b2262afa5a6.title: Department for Transport
16eb9fe0-4cb9-464c-befc-9b2262afa5a6.description: The Department of Transport (DfT) work with  agencies and partners to support the transport network that helps the UK’s businesses and gets people and goods travelling around the country. The DfT plan and invest in transport infrastructure to keep the UK on the move.

c6845a0c-fc05-4ad3-b7e7-6a8239121988.name: care-quality-commission
c6845a0c-fc05-4ad3-b7e7-6a8239121988.title: Care Quality Commission
c6845a0c-fc05-4ad3-b7e7-6a8239121988.description:
The Care Quality Commission (CQC) are the independent regulator of health and adult social care in England.

The CQC make sure health and social care services provide people with safe, effective, compassionate, high-quality care and encourage care services to improve.

420115ad-7563-4a9e-b752-304fa7b81327.name: uk-sport
420115ad-7563-4a9e-b752-304fa7b81327.title: UK Sport
420115ad-7563-4a9e-b752-304fa7b81327.description:
> UK Sport provides strategic investment to enable Great Britain’s Olympic and Paralympic sports and athletes to achieve their full medal winning potential.      
>
> Since UK Sport was founded by Royal Charter in 1997 they have taken GB from 36th in the Olympic medal table at Atlanta to third in the Olympic and Paralympic medal table at London 2012.       
>
> UK Sport has a very clear remit at the ‘top end’ of Britain’s sporting pathway supporting athletes and sports to compete and win medals at the Olympic and Paralympic Games. UK Sport has no direct involvement in community or school sport.     
>
> UK Sport investment and support services cover:    
>
* Performance (Investment, Evaluation, Solutions)
* Events (Investment, Bidding, Support)
* International (Influence, Development)
* Governance, Leadership, Financial Accounting
* Science, Medicine and Technology (via the Home Nation Institutes)
>
> For further information please visit http://www.uksport.gov.uk/

cb581326-3173-417d-a743-03a26a93ab26.name: white-rose-shopping-centre
cb581326-3173-417d-a743-03a26a93ab26.title: White Rose Shopping Centre
cb581326-3173-417d-a743-03a26a93ab26.description:
With over 100 shops at White Rose, including all your high street favourites as well as little specialist gems, you will be sure to find a little something.

White Rose is a doddle to get to on the south side of Leeds, off junction 28 of the M62. It’s less than 3 miles from the city centre, and within easy walking and cycling distance of local residential areas.

To make your visit an enjoyable experience, the Customer Service team make sure that the centre offer a wide range of facilities for all, from families with young children to people with disabilities.

043e8b92-1127-49b7-af02-356e75e2ce7d.name: leeds-observatory
043e8b92-1127-49b7-af02-356e75e2ce7d.title: Leeds Observatory
043e8b92-1127-49b7-af02-356e75e2ce7d.description:
The Leeds Observatory - your 'one-stop-shop' website for information and intelligence about communities in Leeds.

Via the themed links you can find a wide range of information about the diverse make-up of Leeds. The website is provided as a free resource and updated & maintained by Leeds City Council.

21884a4b-1d74-4719-be4d-10454f834f8f.name: city-of-bradford-metropolitan-district-council
21884a4b-1d74-4719-be4d-10454f834f8f.title: City of Bradford Metropolitan District Council
21884a4b-1d74-4719-be4d-10454f834f8f.description: Bradford Council is committed to improving the data they publish in the public interest. To do this they promote openness and transparency by publishing increasing amounts of data.

ad7e2394-b35c-4cb8-880d-f21e43d7bf44.name: otley-all-saints-c-of-e-primary-school
ad7e2394-b35c-4cb8-880d-f21e43d7bf44.title: Otley All Saints C of E Primary School
ad7e2394-b35c-4cb8-880d-f21e43d7bf44.description:
Otley All Saints CE Primary School aim to ensure our children are well equipped academically and socially to transfer to High School with confidence. We believe achievement in all subjects is important, and levels of attainment at the end of Year 6 are high. Otley All Saints also value the wider development of each child and place a strong emphasis on personal and social education, creative abilities and physical education. They offer a range of extra curricular activities for children of all ages.

The value of positive links between home and school is also important to  Otley All Saints and they aim to work closely with parents to ensure maximum benefits for each child.  Children at Otley All Saints CE Primary School are taught in a well equipped, stimulating environment by a team of dedicated staff. The school is in an attractive setting and enjoys a very good local reputation.

Otley All Saints CE Primary School aim to ensure that every child enjoys a successful and rewarding primary school life.

09993164-032d-4870-b4b8-f6001ddc2eca.name: odi-leeds
09993164-032d-4870-b4b8-f6001ddc2eca.title: ODI Leeds
09993164-032d-4870-b4b8-f6001ddc2eca.description:
The Open Data Institute is catalysing the evolution of open data culture to create economic, environmental and social value. It helps unlock supply, generates demand, and creates and disseminates knowledge to address local and global issues.

The ODI convene world-class experts to collaborate, incubate, nurture and mentor new ideas, and promote innovation. We enable anyone to learn and engage with open data, and empower our teams to help others through professional coaching and mentoring.

Leeds is proud to host an ODI Node and be the only city outside of London which has a physical collaboration space.  To find out more, contact paul@actuatedfutures.com.

59944877-5f94-45f5-8dcb-3b5b9b1abc75.name: northern-powergrid
59944877-5f94-45f5-8dcb-3b5b9b1abc75.title: Northern Powergrid
59944877-5f94-45f5-8dcb-3b5b9b1abc75.description: We run the only major electricity distribution network that provides power to customers in the North East, Yorkshire and northern Lincolnshire. We are dedicated to delivering a safe and reliable electricity supply to all our customers, 24 hours a day, every day. We move electricity to and from homes and businesses over our network.

19caf090-5987-4cee-8eb2-c79f0778b193.name: the-leeds-teach-hospitals-nhs-trust
19caf090-5987-4cee-8eb2-c79f0778b193.title: The Leeds Teach Hospitals NHS Trust
19caf090-5987-4cee-8eb2-c79f0778b193.description:
Leeds Teaching Hospitals is one of the biggest NHS trusts in the country, offering a range of both general and specialist hospital services, with excellent clinical outcomes for patients. We have an international reputation for excellence in specialist care, research and academic training.

In this section you can find out lots of information about our organisation, our history, how we are structured, and our vision, purpose and goals.

Ensuring we have well managed hospitals which provide safe, high quality care to every patient, every time, is the ultimate responsibility of the Trust Board, which is leading our drive to become an NHS Foundation Trust.

We genuinely want to work with patients and the public to develop and enhance our services, and welcome feedback on all aspects of our care.

dc747df5-63e3-47df-8878-31e3238f7711.name: leeds-beer-quest
dc747df5-63e3-47df-8878-31e3238f7711.title: Leeds Beer Quest
dc747df5-63e3-47df-8878-31e3238f7711.description:
Leeds city centre has the best variety of pubs and bars of anywhere either of us have lived and we're on a mission to review them all.  Our definition of a drinking establishment is pretty loose.  Karaoke bars are in, casinos are out.  Hotels and restaurants are in only if they make an effort to attract the local drinking population.  Feel free to add your own reviews of these places in the comments.  This site should allow you to give them a star rating out of 5 and the average visitor rating will be shown on each page alongside our review.

These reviews will be biased toward our own personal tastes.  Our number one criterion is beer selection.  We like a wide selection of real ales and rotating guest ales are always a plus.  We also love Belgian imports, American microbrews and all kinds of unusual and international beers.  As for atmosphere: spots that are quiet enough to hold a good conversation without shouting are good, and rooms with giant TVs wall-to-wall, not so.

316884e2-8183-4193-8e50-0bd8ace60af5.name: leeds-civic-trust
316884e2-8183-4193-8e50-0bd8ace60af5.title: Leeds Civic Trust
316884e2-8183-4193-8e50-0bd8ace60af5.description: Leeds Civic Trust stimulate interest in and care for the history and character of the city, encourage high standards of design, architecture and town planning, encourage the improvement of features of public amenity and promote co-operation in the achievement of these objectives.

ec61bf40-03ef-4b9c-94cb-c593764f7984.name: things-to-do-with-data
ec61bf40-03ef-4b9c-94cb-c593764f7984.title: Things to do with data
ec61bf40-03ef-4b9c-94cb-c593764f7984.description: An attempt to bring together open datasets via searchable keys, signposting source data and applications of that data.

718daca9-ec94-4ab9-af4f-852d3dd2adb8.name: leeds-united-football-club
718daca9-ec94-4ab9-af4f-852d3dd2adb8.title: Leeds United Football Club
718daca9-ec94-4ab9-af4f-852d3dd2adb8.description:
Leeds United Football Club is an English football club in Leeds, West Yorkshire.  The club was formed in 1919 following the disbanding of Leeds City F.C. by the Football League and took over their Elland Road stadium.

Leeds United play in white. The club badge features the White Rose of York and "LUFC".

5fdf0d84-0503-4a29-ae46-daf3d9d20f02.name: office-for-low-emission-vehicles1
5fdf0d84-0503-4a29-ae46-daf3d9d20f02.title: Office for Low Emission Vehicles
5fdf0d84-0503-4a29-ae46-daf3d9d20f02.description: The Office for Low Emission Vehicles (OLEV) is a team working across government to support the early market for ultra-low emission vehicles (ULEV). Providing over £900 million to position the UK at the global forefront of ULEV development, manufacture and use. This will contribute to economic growth and will help reduce greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution on our roads.

aa1379b2-cd1b-4a9e-a83c-59dcc8ad30de.name: leeds-and-york-partnership-nhs-foundation-trust
aa1379b2-cd1b-4a9e-a83c-59dcc8ad30de.title: Leeds and York Partnership NHS Foundation Trust
aa1379b2-cd1b-4a9e-a83c-59dcc8ad30de.description:
Leeds and York Partnership NHS Foundation Trust provides specialist mental health and learning disability services to people within Leeds, York, Selby, Tadcaster, Easingwold and parts of North Yorkshire.

Service users are at the heart of our organisation. We constantly strive to provide the best possible care and support, working closely with related organisations to provide effective, accessible and modern mental health and learning disability services.

Working in partnership with our local communities, our core purpose is to improve the mental health and well-being of the people who use our services.

Leeds Partnerships NHS Foundation Trust was awarded NHS Foundation Trust status on 1 August 2007. On 1 February 2012 Leeds Partnerships NHS Foundation Trust merged with mental health and learning disability services from NHS North Yorkshire and York becoming Leeds and York Partnership NHS Foundation Trust.

0c247da4-fed1-425f-88a9-59327fadbf54.name: office-of-national-statistics
0c247da4-fed1-425f-88a9-59327fadbf54.title: Office of National Statistics
0c247da4-fed1-425f-88a9-59327fadbf54.description:
The ONS is the UK Government's main survey organisation and its main producer of official statistics. It is also the central co-ordinating agency for the wider Government Statistical Service (GSS). 
ONS is responsible for producing a wide range of key economic and social statistics which are used by policy makers across government to create evidence-based policies and monitor performance against them.

8810f6cf-a41c-4850-8f2a-b61e8e636afb.name: traveline1
8810f6cf-a41c-4850-8f2a-b61e8e636afb.title: Traveline
8810f6cf-a41c-4850-8f2a-b61e8e636afb.description: Traveline are a partnership of transport companies, local authorities and passenger groups which have come together to bring you routes and times for all travel in Great Britain by bus, rail, coach and ferry, and to provide it in as many different ways as we can so that you can always reach us.

4eb7d057-12d5-489c-baf5-7c38219234e1.name: west-yorkshire-fire-rescue-service
4eb7d057-12d5-489c-baf5-7c38219234e1.title: West Yorkshire Fire & Rescue Service
4eb7d057-12d5-489c-baf5-7c38219234e1.description: West Yorkshire Fire and Rescue Service strives to achieve our ambition and aim. To support this, we have four strategic priorities underpinned by objectives to achieve our ambition for the communities of West Yorkshire. We have a strong and genuine commitment from all staff to ensure equality and diversity in everything we do and to continue making a difference within the various communities that we serve.

06b3f42f-09a7-4aba-b910-c769ff4eb109.name: superfast-west-yorkshire
06b3f42f-09a7-4aba-b910-c769ff4eb109.title: Superfast West Yorkshire
06b3f42f-09a7-4aba-b910-c769ff4eb109.description: Superfast West Yorkshire aims to improve both access and take-up of broadband and superfast broadband in our project area.  We aim to increase the coverage of superfast broadband to 97% of premises in our intervention area by the end of 2015.

04816efc-6e2f-4424-8371-286076c2c74a.name: leeds-art-crawl
04816efc-6e2f-4424-8371-286076c2c74a.title: Leeds Art Crawl
04816efc-6e2f-4424-8371-286076c2c74a.description: An Open Data game highlighting public art, space and audiences in the City of Leeds. Leeds Art Crawl is developed by @shi, @DeShannon and @wetgenes.

a3f84068-130e-4411-9558-f516ee1e560f.name: imactivate
a3f84068-130e-4411-9558-f516ee1e560f.title: Imactivate
a3f84068-130e-4411-9558-f516ee1e560f.description:
Imactivate are a small team, led by Tom Forth, based in Leeds, who write software and work with data to tell stories in a digital world. If you want to visit, they’re at LG3 Studios, LS1 4HT. Imactivte are closely connected to the vibrant creative scene in Leeds, the North of England, and beyond. Lastly, Imactivate are both highly-experienced scientists comfortable with the technical details that stop many great ideas becoming a reality.

If you have an idea that you think Imactivate can help with then please get in touch.

Tweet Tom @thomasforth, or email at thomas.forth@gmail.com, or come round for a chat; they’re quite friendly and have coffee, also the White Cloth Gallery opposite has lovely local beer!

a73c972a-00ad-4e9d-bf42-5d439775dfa5.name: nhs-leeds-north-clinical-commissioning-group
a73c972a-00ad-4e9d-bf42-5d439775dfa5.title: NHS Leeds North Clinical Commissioning Group
a73c972a-00ad-4e9d-bf42-5d439775dfa5.description:
NHS Leeds North Clinical Commissioning Group (CCG) is a new organisation led by GPs and nurses. We work together with patients , communities and GP practices in your area to ensure that the right NHS services are in place to support people and help improve their health and wellbeing. We call this commissioning.        

Leeds North CCG is unique in Leeds because it has a “Council” of members as its core decision-making body. The Council is made up of representatives of each of its 28 member GP practices. It meets every two months so practices can discuss and agree how to tackle health issues affecting their local patients and communities.       

This union of GP practices ensures that participation is at the heart of everything Leeds North CCG does. Our member practices make sure that they are representing the best interests of their patients as well as the wider communities in which they are located.

cfe975ae-0ac0-4609-ba0a-a402eddb0461.name: university-of-leeds
cfe975ae-0ac0-4609-ba0a-a402eddb0461.title: University of Leeds
cfe975ae-0ac0-4609-ba0a-a402eddb0461.description:
The University, established in 1904, is one of the largest higher education institutions in the UK. The University is a world top 100 university and are renowned globally for the quality of teaching and research.

The strength of their academic expertise combined with the breadth of disciplines covered, provides a wealth of opportunities and has real impact on the world in cultural, economic and societal ways.

The University strives to achieve academic excellence within an ethical framework informed by the University values of integrity, equality and inclusion, community and professionalism.

8de30da3-77a3-46b7-920a-66b67493a308.name: department-for-communities-and-local-government
8de30da3-77a3-46b7-920a-66b67493a308.title: Department for Communities and Local Government
8de30da3-77a3-46b7-920a-66b67493a308.description: The Department for Communities and Local Government's job is to create great places to live and work, and to give more power to local people to shape what happens in their area.  DCLG is a ministerial department, supported by 10 agencies and public bodies.

bbd3d69f-54e7-4922-8c1f-58f514a87423.name: leeds-asylum-seekers-support-network
bbd3d69f-54e7-4922-8c1f-58f514a87423.title: Leeds Asylum Seekers Support Network
bbd3d69f-54e7-4922-8c1f-58f514a87423.description:
LASSN wants asylum seekers and refugees to be

Supported and relieved from hardship and distress by local people
Empowered to rebuild their lives, to fulfil their potential and to take control of their lives
Integrated settled and safe. LASSN wants Leeds to be a place of  welcome and understanding; and for the general public, organisations, politicians and policy makers to understand the needs of asylum seekers

4cb33445-570a-43f2-b547-c75581b698a1.name: disabled-access-guide
4cb33445-570a-43f2-b547-c75581b698a1.title: Disabled Access Guide
4cb33445-570a-43f2-b547-c75581b698a1.description:
The Disabled Access Guide aims to provide individuals who are less abled/wheelchair users and their enablers with information about access to public places across the UK. 

The site is a work in progress but the ultimate aim is to give you the information you need to be confident and reassured that you can go out and not worry about anything apart from having a good time.

Just select your city and type of venue which you want information about from the menu on the left or search in the top right corner for the name of the venue. Alternatively, click on the map of the city and browse venues which have been reviewed. Reviews are conducted independently and in an standardised way. 

Find out more at http://www.disabledaccessguide.net/

leedscitycouncil.name: leedscitycouncil
leedscitycouncil.title: Leeds City Council
leedscitycouncil.description: Leeds City Council is committed to being open and transparent.  Our pages on Leeds Data Mill will provide details and easy access to the data and information we publish.  Where possible we are making our data available (subject to licence) in a format that allows you to re-use it.

planning-applications.name: planning-applications
planning-applications.title: Planning applications
planning-applications.author: Leeds City Council
planning-applications.notes:
Dataset showing completed planning applications. This dataset includes the property address the application relates to, type of application and outcome. Please refer to guidance document for further information on what the fields refer to.

Local Government Association/Open Data Institute

Leeds City Council is participating in a scheme run by the LGA and ODI to standardise datasets from local authorities. Public toilets, premises licences, and planning datasets have been identified first to pilot this scheme.

payload.description:
Aspire Community Benefit Society supports people with learning disabilities to have better lives through the provision of high-quality, person-centred, care and support services.  

Aspires purpose is to enhance the quality of the lives of their customers by supporting them to be as independent as possible and reducing the need for residential care.  They want the people they support to have a positive experience of care and support and to ensure they are safeguarded from harm.
payload.name: aspire
payload.title: Aspire

payload.description:
The Care Quality Commission (CQC) are the independent regulator of health and adult social care in England.

The CQC make sure health and social care services provide people with safe, effective, compassionate, high-quality care and encourage care services to improve.
payload.name: care-quality-commission
payload.title: Care Quality Commission

payload.display_name: City of Bradford Metropolitan District Council
payload.description: Bradford Council is committed to improving the data they publish in the public interest. To do this they promote openness and transparency by publishing increasing amounts of data.

payload.description:
Companies House incorporates and dissolves limited companies, registers the information companies are legally required to supply, and makes that information available to the public.
Companies House is an executive agency, sponsored by the Department for Business, Innovation & Skills.

payload.title: Companies House

payload.display_name: Department for Communities and Local Government
payload.description: The Department for Communities and Local Government's job is to create great places to live and work, and to give more power to local people to shape what happens in their area.  DCLG is a ministerial department, supported by 10 agencies and public bodies.
payload.name: department-for-communities-and-local-government
payload.title: Department for Communities and Local Government

payload.description: The Department of Transport (DfT) work with  agencies and partners to support the transport network that helps the UK’s businesses and gets people and goods travelling around the country. The DfT plan and invest in transport infrastructure to keep the UK on the move.
payload.name: department-of-transport
payload.title: Department for Transport

payload.description:
The Disabled Access Guide aims to provide individuals who are less abled/wheelchair users and their enablers with information about access to public places across the UK. 

The site is a work in progress but the ultimate aim is to give you the information you need to be confident and reassured that you can go out and not worry about anything apart from having a good time.

Just select your city and type of venue which you want information about from the menu on the left or search in the top right corner for the name of the venue. Alternatively, click on the map of the city and browse venues which have been reviewed. Reviews are conducted independently and in an standardised way. 

Find out more at http://www.disabledaccessguide.net/
payload.name: disabled-access-guide
payload.title: Disabled Access Guide

payload.description:
The Environment Agency (EA) work to create better places for people and wildlife, and support sustainable development.
EA is an executive non-departmental public body, sponsored by the Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs.
payload.name: environment-agency
payload.title: Environment Agency

payload.description: Transforming the ways that cities are understood - www.hebeworks.com
payload.name: hebe-works
payload.title: Hebe Works

payload.description: From the archaeology under our feet to the historic parks we love, from precious memories to rare wildlife… we use money raised by National Lottery players to help people across the UK explore, enjoy and protect the heritage they care about.
payload.name: heritage-lottery-fund
payload.title: Heritage Lottery Fund

payload.description: We are the national provider of information, data and IT systems for commissioners, analysts and clinicians in health and social care.  Based in Leeds, HSCIC is an executive non-departmental public body, sponsored by the Department of Health.
payload.name: hscic
payload.title: HSCIC

payload.description:
Imactivate are a small team, led by Tom Forth, based in Leeds, who write software and work with data to tell stories in a digital world. If you want to visit, they’re at LG3 Studios, LS1 4HT. Imactivte are closely connected to the vibrant creative scene in Leeds, the North of England, and beyond. Lastly, Imactivate are both highly-experienced scientists comfortable with the technical details that stop many great ideas becoming a reality.

If you have an idea that you think Imactivate can help with then please get in touch.

Tweet Tom @thomasforth, or email at thomas.forth@gmail.com, or come round for a chat; they’re quite friendly and have coffee, also the White Cloth Gallery opposite has lovely local beer!
payload.name: imactivate
payload.title: Imactivate

payload.description: Leeds City Council hosts occasional hack events, or Innovation Labs.  Here, we team up analysts, developers, service staff, and users to come up with innovative solutions to everyday issues.
payload.name: lcc-innovation-labs
payload.title: LCC INNOVATION LABS

payload.display_name: Leeds and York Partnership NHS Foundation Trust
payload.description:
Leeds and York Partnership NHS Foundation Trust provides specialist mental health and learning disability services to people within Leeds, York, Selby, Tadcaster, Easingwold and parts of North Yorkshire.

Service users are at the heart of our organisation. We constantly strive to provide the best possible care and support, working closely with related organisations to provide effective, accessible and modern mental health and learning disability services.

Working in partnership with our local communities, our core purpose is to improve the mental health and well-being of the people who use our services.

Leeds Partnerships NHS Foundation Trust was awarded NHS Foundation Trust status on 1 August 2007. On 1 February 2012 Leeds Partnerships NHS Foundation Trust merged with mental health and learning disability services from NHS North Yorkshire and York becoming Leeds and York Partnership NHS Foundation Trust.
payload.name: leeds-and-york-partnership-nhs-foundation-trust
payload.title: Leeds and York Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

payload.description: An Open Data game highlighting public art, space and audiences in the City of Leeds. Leeds Art Crawl is developed by @shi, @DeShannon and @wetgenes.
payload.name: leeds-art-crawl
payload.title: Leeds Art Crawl

payload.description:
LASSN wants asylum seekers and refugees to be

Supported and relieved from hardship and distress by local people
Empowered to rebuild their lives, to fulfil their potential and to take control of their lives
Integrated settled and safe. LASSN wants Leeds to be a place of  welcome and understanding; and for the general public, organisations, politicians and policy makers to understand the needs of asylum seekers
payload.name: leeds-asylum-seekers-support-network
payload.title: Leeds Asylum Seekers Support Network

payload.description:
Leeds city centre has the best variety of pubs and bars of anywhere either of us have lived and we're on a mission to review them all.  Our definition of a drinking establishment is pretty loose.  Karaoke bars are in, casinos are out.  Hotels and restaurants are in only if they make an effort to attract the local drinking population.  Feel free to add your own reviews of these places in the comments.  This site should allow you to give them a star rating out of 5 and the average visitor rating will be shown on each page alongside our review.

These reviews will be biased toward our own personal tastes.  Our number one criterion is beer selection.  We like a wide selection of real ales and rotating guest ales are always a plus.  We also love Belgian imports, American microbrews and all kinds of unusual and international beers.  As for atmosphere: spots that are quiet enough to hold a good conversation without shouting are good, and rooms with giant TVs wall-to-wall, not so.
payload.name: leeds-beer-quest
payload.title: Leeds Beer Quest

payload.description: Leeds City Council is committed to being open and transparent.  Our pages on Leeds Data Mill will provide details and easy access to the data and information we publish.  Where possible we are making our data available (subject to licence) in a format that allows you to re-use it.

payload.title: Leeds City Council

payload.description: Leeds Civic Trust stimulate interest in and care for the history and character of the city, encourage high standards of design, architecture and town planning, encourage the improvement of features of public amenity and promote co-operation in the achievement of these objectives.
payload.name: leeds-civic-trust
payload.title: Leeds Civic Trust

payload.description: Dat Mill North is the Open Data Platform for the city -  a place for organisations to share their Open Data.
payload.name: leeds-data-mill
payload.title: Data Mill North

payload.description: Leeds Housing Concern began as a charity in the 1970's providing housing and support for single homeless people. Now a highly successful organisation, LHC continue to develop new, often pioneering services for people struggling to cope with a broad range of issues including learning difficulties, drug abuse and domestic violence.
payload.name: leeds-housing-concern
payload.title: Leeds Housing Concern

payload.description:
The Leeds Observatory - your 'one-stop-shop' website for information and intelligence about communities in Leeds.

Via the themed links you can find a wide range of information about the diverse make-up of Leeds. The website is provided as a free resource and updated & maintained by Leeds City Council.
payload.name: leeds-observatory
payload.title: Leeds Observatory

payload.description:
Leeds United Football Club is an English football club in Leeds, West Yorkshire.  The club was formed in 1919 following the disbanding of Leeds City F.C. by the Football League and took over their Elland Road stadium.

Leeds United play in white. The club badge features the White Rose of York and "LUFC".
payload.name: leeds-united-football-club
payload.title: Leeds United Football Club

payload.description:
How does the weather affect your life? Is it just about getting out and about at weekends? Or does it impact your work, your livelihood or even your health?

Right across the world, every single day, people make decisions based on the weather. The Met Office provide weather and climate forecasts to help with those decisions so people can be safe, well and prosperous.
payload.name: met-office
payload.title: Met Office

payload.description: Providing information from Network Rail and National Rail Enquiries.
payload.name: national-rail
payload.title: National Rail

payload.display_name: NHS Leeds North Clinical Commissioning Group
payload.description:
NHS Leeds North Clinical Commissioning Group (CCG) is a new organisation led by GPs and nurses. We work together with patients , communities and GP practices in your area to ensure that the right NHS services are in place to support people and help improve their health and wellbeing. We call this commissioning.        

Leeds North CCG is unique in Leeds because it has a “Council” of members as its core decision-making body. The Council is made up of representatives of each of its 28 member GP practices. It meets every two months so practices can discuss and agree how to tackle health issues affecting their local patients and communities.       

This union of GP practices ensures that participation is at the heart of everything Leeds North CCG does. Our member practices make sure that they are representing the best interests of their patients as well as the wider communities in which they are located.
payload.name: nhs-leeds-north-clinical-commissioning-group
payload.title: NHS Leeds North Clinical Commissioning Group

payload.description: We run the only major electricity distribution network that provides power to customers in the North East, Yorkshire and northern Lincolnshire. We are dedicated to delivering a safe and reliable electricity supply to all our customers, 24 hours a day, every day. We move electricity to and from homes and businesses over our network.
payload.name: northern-powergrid
payload.title: Northern Powergrid

payload.description:
The Open Data Institute is catalysing the evolution of open data culture to create economic, environmental and social value. It helps unlock supply, generates demand, and creates and disseminates knowledge to address local and global issues.

The ODI convene world-class experts to collaborate, incubate, nurture and mentor new ideas, and promote innovation. We enable anyone to learn and engage with open data, and empower our teams to help others through professional coaching and mentoring.

Leeds is proud to host an ODI Node and be the only city outside of London which has a physical collaboration space.  To find out more, contact paul@actuatedfutures.com.
payload.name: odi-leeds
payload.title: ODI Leeds

payload.description: The Office for Low Emission Vehicles (OLEV) is a team working across government to support the early market for ultra-low emission vehicles (ULEV). Providing over £900 million to position the UK at the global forefront of ULEV development, manufacture and use. This will contribute to economic growth and will help reduce greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution on our roads.
payload.name: office-for-low-emission-vehicles1
payload.title: Office for Low Emission Vehicles

payload.description:
The ONS is the UK Government's main survey organisation and its main producer of official statistics. It is also the central co-ordinating agency for the wider Government Statistical Service (GSS). 
ONS is responsible for producing a wide range of key economic and social statistics which are used by policy makers across government to create evidence-based policies and monitor performance against them.
payload.name: office-of-national-statistics
payload.title: Office of National Statistics

payload.description: Ordnance Survey is the national mapping agency for Great Britain and is one of the world's largest producers of maps.
payload.name: ordnance-survey
payload.title: Ordnance Survey

payload.display_name: Otley All Saints C of E Primary School
payload.description:
Otley All Saints CE Primary School aim to ensure our children are well equipped academically and socially to transfer to High School with confidence. We believe achievement in all subjects is important, and levels of attainment at the end of Year 6 are high. Otley All Saints also value the wider development of each child and place a strong emphasis on personal and social education, creative abilities and physical education. They offer a range of extra curricular activities for children of all ages.

The value of positive links between home and school is also important to  Otley All Saints and they aim to work closely with parents to ensure maximum benefits for each child.  Children at Otley All Saints CE Primary School are taught in a well equipped, stimulating environment by a team of dedicated staff. The school is in an attractive setting and enjoys a very good local reputation.

Otley All Saints CE Primary School aim to ensure that every child enjoys a successful and rewarding primary school life.
payload.name: otley-all-saints-c-of-e-primary-school
payload.title: Otley All Saints C of E Primary School

payload.description:
An independent site about your experiences of UK health services, good or bad. Patient Opinion pass your stories to the right people to make a difference. 
Patient Opinion was founded in 2005 and is now the UK's leading independent non-profit feedback platform for health services.
Patient Opinion is about honest and meaningful conversations between patients and health services. We believe that your story can help make health services better.
payload.name: patient-opinion
payload.title: Patient Opinion

payload.description: Based in Leeds and established in 2015, Student Data Labs envisions a future where more students can gain highly sought-after data skills that prepare them for entering the labour market upon graduation. The Labs offer a collaborative space for students from a variety of academic backgrounds to undertake real-world data projects, learning practical skills whilst working on projects that have a social purpose.
payload.name: student-data-labs
payload.title: Student Data Labs

payload.description: Superfast West Yorkshire aims to improve both access and take-up of broadband and superfast broadband in our project area.  We aim to increase the coverage of superfast broadband to 97% of premises in our intervention area by the end of 2015.
payload.name: superfast-west-yorkshire
payload.title: Superfast West Yorkshire

payload.display_name: The Leeds Teach Hospitals NHS Trust
payload.description:
Leeds Teaching Hospitals is one of the biggest NHS trusts in the country, offering a range of both general and specialist hospital services, with excellent clinical outcomes for patients. We have an international reputation for excellence in specialist care, research and academic training.

In this section you can find out lots of information about our organisation, our history, how we are structured, and our vision, purpose and goals.

Ensuring we have well managed hospitals which provide safe, high quality care to every patient, every time, is the ultimate responsibility of the Trust Board, which is leading our drive to become an NHS Foundation Trust.

We genuinely want to work with patients and the public to develop and enhance our services, and welcome feedback on all aspects of our care.
payload.name: the-leeds-teach-hospitals-nhs-trust
payload.title: The Leeds Teach Hospitals NHS Trust

payload.description: An attempt to bring together open datasets via searchable keys, signposting source data and applications of that data.
payload.name: things-to-do-with-data
payload.title: Things to do with data

payload.description: Traveline are a partnership of transport companies, local authorities and passenger groups which have come together to bring you routes and times for all travel in Great Britain by bus, rail, coach and ferry, and to provide it in as many different ways as we can so that you can always reach us.
payload.name: traveline1
payload.title: Traveline

payload.description:
> UK Sport provides strategic investment to enable Great Britain’s Olympic and Paralympic sports and athletes to achieve their full medal winning potential.      
>
> Since UK Sport was founded by Royal Charter in 1997 they have taken GB from 36th in the Olympic medal table at Atlanta to third in the Olympic and Paralympic medal table at London 2012.       
>
> UK Sport has a very clear remit at the ‘top end’ of Britain’s sporting pathway supporting athletes and sports to compete and win medals at the Olympic and Paralympic Games. UK Sport has no direct involvement in community or school sport.     
>
> UK Sport investment and support services cover:    
>
* Performance (Investment, Evaluation, Solutions)
* Events (Investment, Bidding, Support)
* International (Influence, Development)
* Governance, Leadership, Financial Accounting
* Science, Medicine and Technology (via the Home Nation Institutes)
>
> For further information please visit http://www.uksport.gov.uk/
payload.name: uk-sport
payload.title: UK Sport

payload.description:
The University, established in 1904, is one of the largest higher education institutions in the UK. The University is a world top 100 university and are renowned globally for the quality of teaching and research.

The strength of their academic expertise combined with the breadth of disciplines covered, provides a wealth of opportunities and has real impact on the world in cultural, economic and societal ways.

The University strives to achieve academic excellence within an ethical framework informed by the University values of integrity, equality and inclusion, community and professionalism.
payload.name: university-of-leeds
payload.title: University of Leeds

payload.description: Aiding the development and delivery of individual member councils’ key growth projects and future local plans. Improving local and regional transport links to underpin the development of business and the creation of new jobs.
payload.name: west-yorkshire-combined-authority
payload.title: West Yorkshire Combined Authority

payload.description: West Yorkshire Fire and Rescue Service strives to achieve our ambition and aim. To support this, we have four strategic priorities underpinned by objectives to achieve our ambition for the communities of West Yorkshire. We have a strong and genuine commitment from all staff to ensure equality and diversity in everything we do and to continue making a difference within the various communities that we serve.
payload.name: west-yorkshire-fire-rescue-service
payload.title: West Yorkshire Fire & Rescue Service

payload.description: West Yorkshire Joint Services are provided by a Joint Committee of Councillors from the five District Councils within West Yorkshire (Bradford, Calderdale, Kirklees, Leeds, Wakefield). Services include archaeology, archive, ecology, materials testing, analytical services and training standards services.
payload.name: west-yorkshire-joint-services
payload.title: West Yorkshire Joint Services

payload.description:
With over 100 shops at White Rose, including all your high street favourites as well as little specialist gems, you will be sure to find a little something.

White Rose is a doddle to get to on the south side of Leeds, off junction 28 of the M62. It’s less than 3 miles from the city centre, and within easy walking and cycling distance of local residential areas.

To make your visit an enjoyable experience, the Customer Service team make sure that the centre offer a wide range of facilities for all, from families with young children to people with disabilities.
payload.name: white-rose-shopping-centre
payload.title: White Rose Shopping Centre

payload.description:
We manage the collection, treatment and distribution of water in Yorkshire, supplying around 1.24 billion litres of drinking water each day - that's a lot of water.

At the same time we also collect, treat and dispose of about one billion litres of waste water safely back into the environment.
payload.name: yorkshire-water
payload.title: Yorkshire Water
